case_vignette: A 56-year-old man comes to the physician for a follow-up examination one week after a chest x-ray showed a solitary pulmonary nodule. He has no history of major medical illness. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. A tuberculin skin test is negative. A CT scan of the chest shows a 2.1-cm well-circumscribed, calcified nodule in the periphery of the right lower lung field. A CT-guided biopsy of the lesion is performed. Histological examination of the biopsy specimen shows regions of disorganized hyaline cartilage interspersed with myxoid regions and clefts of ciliated epithelium.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm actually not experiencing any symptoms right now.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications? If so, could you please list them?
I have no history of major medical illness and I'm not on any medications.
Have you noticed any unusual bruising, bleeding, or prolonged bleeding after cuts or injuries?
No, I haven't noticed any unusual bruising, bleeding, or prolonged bleeding.
Have you experienced any unexplained weight loss or fatigue recently?
No, I haven't experienced unexplained weight loss or fatigue.
Do you have any family history of blood disorders or cancers?
I haven't mentioned any family history of blood disorders or cancers.
Have you had any recent unexplained fevers or night sweats?
No, I've had no unexplained fevers or night sweats.
Thank you for your responses. Based on your answers, I would like to order some blood tests and potentially a bone marrow biopsy to further evaluate your condition.
